content.description:
A Sacred Duty

Sacra suosque tibi1 commendatcommendo, -are: to entrust Troia PenatesPenates, -ium, m. pl.: the Penates (the gods of the household) ; 
hos cape fatorum comites, his moenia quaere 
magna pererratopererro, -are, -avi, -atus = erro, -are statuesstatuo, -ere = constituo, -ere quae denique pontopontus, -i, m. = aequor, -oris.
 1:refers to Aeneas↩
content.question: In lines 2-3, hos cape fatorum comites, his moenia quaere magna is translated

choices.label: take these companions of fate and seek great walls for them
the companions will take this fate and seek these great walls
with some taken as the companions of fate, with others great walls were sought
for some, the companions were taken by fate, for others great walls were sought

content.answer: take these companions of fate and seek great walls for them

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12
